titleInfo.title: Suitablity of strawberry (Fragaria x ananassa Duch.) microplants to the field cultivation

name.affiliation: Department of Genetics and Horticultural Plant Breeding, Agricultural University of Lublin, Akademicka 15, 20-950 Lublin, Poland.
Department of Genetics and Horticultural Plant Breeding, Agricultural University of Lublin, Akademicka 15, 20-950 Lublin, Poland.

mods.abstract: Suitability of strawberry microplants of cv. Teresa to the field cultivation was examined. In comparison to vegetatively propagated plants, microplants produced more leaves, runners and inflorescences. Also, yielding and resistance to leaf scorch of these plants were much higher. Good condition of microplants in the autumn positively influenced on the plant vigour and yielding in the next year of cultivation. The obtained results displayed, that strawberry microplants of cv. Teresa were more suitable for field cultivation when compared with standard propagated seedlings.

titleInfo.title: Journal of Food, Agriculture and Environment
